Installation¶

The bapsflib package is still in active development so it has not been registered with PyPI. Once a stable release is achieve, the package will be registered and, then, can be directly installed with:

pip3 install bapsflib

Directly from GitHub¶

Note

Will need a version of git installed locally, see installation here.

A copy of bapsflib can be installed into Python’s site-packages directory using the pip3 installer. To install, invoke the following command:

pip3 install git+https://github.com/rocco8773/bapsflib.git#egg=bapsflib

Now, the bapsflib package can be imported like any other Python package.

Since bapsflib is not currently registered on PyPI, to upgrade the package the following command has to be used:

pip3 install --upgrade git+https://github.com/rocco8773/bapsflib.git#egg=bapsflib

From a Local GitHub Clone¶

The second option is to install from a local copy of the GitHub repository. A copy can be made one of two ways, (1) download a copy directly from the GitHub repository or (2) make a git clone of the repository. To download a copy, go to the bapsflib repository, find the Clone or download button, choose Download ZIP, save to a location of choice, and unpack. To install the package, in the terminal, navigate to the bapsflib package main directory where the setup.py file is located and run the following command:

pip3 install .

This will install the bapsflib package in Python’s site-packages directory. Like above, the --upgrade argument for pip3 will not work with this option.

The second method involves making a local clone of the GitHub repository. Start in a terminal window, navigate to where the local bapsflib copy will reside, and perform the following command:

git clone https://github.com/rocco8773/bapsflib

This will create a clone on your local disk that is under a git version control system (VCS). This allows the clone to be easily updated when the GitHub repository is updated. To do so, navigate into the bapsflib package where the .git file is located. Using the command

git pull

the master branch on the GitHub repository will be merged into the local clone. This local clone can be installed into Python’s site-packages directory using pip3 install ., but again the --upgrade argument will not work with this setup. Instead, the bapsflib package can also be install with and editable tag

pip3 install -e .

which will create a link in Python’s path to the local package. Thus, any edits to the local copy will immediately be available in the Python environment. Thus, updating the package involves performing the command git pull on the local clone.

Useful Links¶

  • bapsflib repository: https://https://github.com/rocco8773/bapsflib
  • setuptools documentation: https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html
  • pip documentation: https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/
  • git installation: https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Getting-Started-Installing-Git
